article:
A 'reed level' is an Arabic invention for determining level for the purpose of
construction. A hole is put through a long straight reed and water is poured
into the center. When the flow out of both sides is equal, the reed is level. "[http://www.history-science-
technology.com/Articles/articles%2011.htm Engineering in Arabic-Islamic
Civilization]", Donald R. Hill and Ahmad Y. al-Hassan The device serves
the same purpose as a spirit level.
